existsEventMemory

public boolean existsEventMemory(java.lang.String query,
                                 java.lang.String eventType)
Search in this agentsubject's memory for perception event of type 'eventType' with given query-string 'query'.

Parameters:
query - String has form '[x,y]' with x as first index (1 is smallest index!) and y as last index in agent's memory.
eventType - Type of perception event to look for.
Returns:
true if event exists. false otherwise

existsEventMemory

public boolean existsEventMemory(java.lang.String query,
                                 java.lang.String eventType,
                                 java.lang.String pattern,
                                 java.lang.Object... values)
Search in this agentsubject's memory for perception event of type 'eventType' with given query-string 'query'. If an event of that type exists, use 'pattern' and 'values' to search for an event that meets the conditions. (See method getFirstIndexWith() for more information about the 'pattern' argument).

Parameters:
query - String has form '[x,y]' with x as first index (1 is smallest index!) and y as last index in agent's memory.
eventType - Type of perception event to look for.
pattern - Conditions
values - Values for String 'pattern'
Returns:
true if event exists. false otherwise

public java.lang.Object[] getLastSearchResults()

Returns:
Array of search results

                                         java.lang.String eventType)
Search in this agentsubject's memory for perception event of type 'eventType' with given query-string 'query'.

Parameters:
query - String has form '[x,y]' with x as first index (1 is smallest index!) and y as last index in agent's memory.
eventType - Type of perception event to look for.
Returns:
Array of search results

getFirstIndexWith

public int getFirstIndexWith(java.lang.String pattern,
                             java.lang.Object... values)
Get the first index in search-results that matches the given condition in the string pattern. For informations on the pattern format see AgentMemory#getFirstIndexWith(String pattern, Object... values)

Parameters:
pattern - Conditions
values - Values
Returns:
The first index in lastResults, that matches the given conditions. -1 if there was an error or no match.
See Also:
AgentMemory, AgentMemory.getFirstIndexWith(String pattern, Object... values)

removeBeliefEntityTriple

public void removeBeliefEntityTriple(long id,
                                     java.lang.String propName)
Remove a certain triple of a belief entity. The requested data is the subject and property. All triples having this subject and property are removed no matter which is the object

Parameters:
id - the ID of the belief entity
propName - the property of the belief entity

public java.util.List<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> executeQuery(java.lang.String queryLanguage,

                                                                                  throws java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError

Parameters:
queryLanguage - The language query. Not Case sensitive. It is recommended to use constants from each Query class

Returns:

protected java.util.ArrayList<Entity> getBeliefEntitiesByType(java.lang.String type)
Return a list containing all beliefs from a given type name E.G. getBeliefsByType("City"), where City is a belief type The type is the short name of the inner class (without package and outer class)

type - the string containing the belief type name
Returns:
the list containing all agent's beliefs about that type

generateUniqueBeliefId

public long generateUniqueBeliefId()
Generate an unique ID used for create a belief entity. The id is different than any other belief ID that belongs to this agent. The ID is in range of positive long values. The range used is the last 1/4 part of the MIN_VALUE (the most negativeof long type and the last 1/4 part MAX_VALUE for long type

Returns:
an unique ID for beliefs of this agent

incrementBeliefEntityPropVal

public boolean incrementBeliefEntityPropVal(long id,
                                            java.lang.String propertyName,
                                            java.lang.Number value)
Increments the value of the property with the specified value. If the property has a numeric type, then the + operator is used to increase the property's value with the specified value. If the value is not of numeric type, a warning is shown, but the program continue to work

Parameters:
id - the Id of the belief
propertyName - the property name (which needs to be updated)
value - the value to be added
Returns:
true if operation is successful, false otherwise

decrementBeliefEntityPropVal

public boolean decrementBeliefEntityPropVal(long id,
                                            java.lang.String propertyName,
                                            java.lang.Number value)
Decrements the value of the property with the specified value. If the property has a numeric type, then increment use the - operator to decrease the property's value with the specified value. If the value is not of numeric type, a warning is shown, but the program continue to work

Parameters:
id - the Id of the belief
propertyName - the property name (which needs to be updated)
value - the value to be subtracted
Returns:
true if operation is successful, false otherwise

activateMonitoring

public void activateMonitoring()
Description copied from interface: Rollbackable
Activates the rollback mechanism. After the activation each property change is monitored until the changes are acceptes or rejected.

Specified by:
activateMonitoring in interface Rollbackable

acceptChanges

public void acceptChanges()
Description copied from interface: Rollbackable
Accepts all property changes that were made during the monitored phase. With accepting the changes the monitoring phase ends. If the monitoring is not activated this method has no effect.

Specified by:
acceptChanges in interface Rollbackable

rejectChanges

public void rejectChanges()
Description copied from interface: Rollbackable
Rejects all property changes that were made during the monitored phase. With rejecting the changes the monitoring phase ends and the properties' states are set to their state before the monitoring started. If the monitoring is not activated this method has no effect.

Specified by:
rejectChanges in interface Rollbackable

public void setAgentSimulator(AgentSimulator simulator)
